2006T101-d-01-28-06-BB.Narrative: ON JANUARY 28, 2006, APPROXIMATELY 1330 HOURS, CSXT TRAIN U70429 DERAILED THE 24TH HEAD CAR ON THE BUCKINGHAM BRANCH MAIN LINE AT MILEPOST CA 203.9 (AFTON, VA).  CAUSE CAR WAS: CSXT 392641.  THE R1 AND L1 WHEELS WERE ON THE GROUND.  AT THE POINT WHERE THE TRAIN HAD STOPPED, THE CAUSE CAR WHEEL WAS ON THE GROUND FOR A DISTANCE OF 2176 FEET FROM POD.  THE CAR HAD WHEEL AND BRAKE ASSEMBLY DAMAGE ON THE B-END.  TRACK DAMAGE AT THIS LOCATION WAS MINIMAL.  HOWEVER, FURTHER INVESTIGATION REVEALED THATTHE CAUSE CAR HAD DERAILED EARLIER (APPROXIMATELY 1200 HOURS) BETWEEN MILEPOST CA 185.2 (FARMINGTON)AND 189.6 (IVY).  IT WAS AT IVY THAT THE CAR RERAILED.  THE CREW REPORTED THAT THE CSXT AM TRAIN DISPATCHER HAD RADIOED THE CREW AND WANTED TO KNOW IF THE CREW FELT ANY UNUSUAL MOTION AT MILEPOST CA187.96 WHERE THERE IS A PUBLIC AT GRADE CROSSING (THIS WAS BEFORE THE CAR RERAILED ITSELF).  THE DISPATCHER HAD A REPORT (FROM A CITIZEN) THAT THE GRADE CROSSING WAS DAMAGED.  THE CREW RESPONDED THATTHEY DID NOT FEEL ANY UNUSUAL MOTIONS AT THE GRADE CROSSING.  THE DISPATCHER RADIOED BACK AND TOLD THE CREW TO STOP AND CHECK THE FRONT END OF THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE (CSXT 4769) FOR POSSIBLE DAMAGE.  CREW STOPPED THE TRAIN AND CHECKED THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE--NO DAMAGE.  IT WAS ALSO AT THIS TIME THAT THE CAUSE CAR HAD WHEELS ON THE GROUND. X02013106-d-01-31-06-FEC.Narrative: ACCORDING TO A DAYTONA BEACH POLICE OFFICER, DRIVER WAS HEADING EASTBOUND ON SECOND AVENUE.  WHEN HEDROVE OVER THE CROSSING AT SECOND AVENUE, HE DROVE OFF OF THE SOUTH SIDE OF CROSSING.  THE FRONT BOTTOM OF THE CAR WAS SITTING ON THE PAVED EDGE OF THE CROSSING.  TRAIN WAS NORTHBOUND AND WHEN CREW SAW THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT MOVING, THEY PUT TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY BRAKING.  AS TRAIN CAME CLOSER, CREW SAW A MALE JUMP OUT OF THE VEHICLE AND FLEE THE AREA.  TRAIN WAS UNABLE TO STOP PRIOR TO IMPACT.NO PERSONAL INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.  CAB COMPANY SAW BLUE LIGHTS AS THEY WERE ARRIVING TO PICK UPCUSTOMER AND CALLED POLICE TO SEE IF THEY WERE LOOKING FOR ANYONE.  REGISTERED OWNER OF VEHICLE WASCUSTOMER THAT HAD CALLED CAB.  HE REFUSED TO TALK TO POLICE IN REFERENCE TO INCIDENT.  THEY WERE NOTABLE TO PUT HIM BEHIND THE WHEEL SO THEY PUT HIM IN PROTECTIVE CUSTODY FOR ALCOHOL ABUSE DUE TO HIMBEING EXTREMELY INTOXICATED.

2006008-d-01-06-06-ICE.Narrative:
TRAIN WAS EASTBOUND ON METRA`S 2 MAIN WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUNDCARS DERAILED.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

CAR DME 26581 INITIALLY DERAILED AT MP 40.9 ON THE IC&E RAILROAD AND RE-RAILED ITSELF AT APPROXIMATELY MP 39.8 ON METRA TRACKAGE.  AT THE INITIAL DERAILMENTON IC&E TRACKAGE, EXCEPTION WAS TAKEN TO THE SPEED AT WHICH THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELING THROUGH A 10 MPHSLOW ORDER.  EXCEPTION WAS ALSO TAKEN TO THE TRACK ELEVATION AND TRUCK ON B-END OF CAR.

THE TRAIN PROGRESSED EASTWARD TO METRA MP 32.5 AT WHICH POINT FOUR CARS DERAILED.  

WHEN DME 26581 RERAILED ITSELF AT MP 39.8, THE ADAPTOR ON THE R-2 WHEEL SHIFTED OUT OF PLACE.  THE ADAPTOR BEING OUT OF PLACE ALLOWED THE SIDE FRAME TO BURN OFF THE END CAP OF THE AXLE.  THEN ALLOWED THE SIDE FRAME PEDESTAL TO DROP TO THE TIES CAUSING THE DERAILMENT.

CRLCS06001-d-01-02-06-CRL.Narrative:
AT 15:30 THE 800O BLUE ISLAND JOB WAS OPERATING IN AN EASTWARD DIRECTION ON THE WEST LEG OF THE GRESHAM WYE WHEN 8CAR OF DE-NATURED ALCOHOL DERAILED. TRAIN WAS HANDLING 68 LOADS AND 3 EMPTIES. ALL DERAILED CARS ARE UPRIGHT AND NONE OF THEM LEAKED THEIR CONTENTS.
CARS WERE RERAILED AND CAUSE OF DERAILMENT DETERMINED TO BE WIDE GAGE. THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS 6 CAR LENGTHS FROM THE ENTRACNCE TO THE WET LEG OF THE GRESHAM WYE.
